column4: okay, so i did a fresh install yesterday, and i put /home on a sepperate partition and then later realized it was too small and gparted refuses to let me make it larger, so is there a way i can delete the partition and just have /home on the same partition as the rest of the drive?
you can't resize while the partition is mounted.. boot to the live cd and use that to adjust
it's the live CD that won't let me do it
you might be looking at the live cd's /home and not your physical /home.. that's the only use case that I can think of unless you don't have the room to make it bigger.
was /home right next to / ? and are you using the graphical "drag the bar" to increase the size
the partitions are labeled sda<number>, what is the labeling for / and for /home?
no.. the partition editor should tell you..
really hard to do this from there..
/home is on /dev/sda1 and the rest is on /dev/sda2
ok when you reduced the size of root (sda2) did you reduce it from the end of the partition or the beginning?
then you should be able to stretch the end of /home to the beginning of root

in the partition editor pick the partition with the drop down menu in the upper right and on the graphical display of the space used you should be able to drag the right or left edge of the partition in the direction needed.
your on KDE? kubuntu?  not sure if the partition editor looks the same there as it does on gnome.. probably but....
did you just install recently? and if so are you dual booting?
you could sudo apt-get install ubuntu-desktop from inside a termial if you wanted gnome.. kde is a different animal since 4.xx .. I haven't played with it.
you could also just reinstall and manually partition during the process
you haven't accumulated anything that you can't do without.. a reinstall would only take 40 mins. or so.

no problem.. I occationally run kubuntu in a vm in vbox.. nice.. but I need a production machine and kubuntu is still developing .. that is the new kde is still in growing pains.. it's pretty though.. I like it.
